dir-section.heading: Education
dir-section.p: Compulsory education begins at the age of seven and lasts for nine years. Students may then attend either general secondÂ­ary school or vocational school. In 2018/19 enrolment at pre-primary schools was equivalent to 94.3% of children in the relevant age-group. In 2021/22 enrolment in primary education was equivalent to 98.2% of children (males 98.1%; females 98.2%) in the relevant age-group. In 2021/22 lower secondary education enrolment included 98.4% of children (males 98.5%; females 98.4%) in the relevant age-group, while enrolment in upper secondary education included 93.6% (males 93.1%; females 94.2%) of those in the relevant age-group. The general government budget for education in 2021 was equivalent to 14.3% of total spending. The Government has announced plans to withdraw funding from Russian-language schools in Estonia by 2030.
